E ngland secured a 1-0 win over Tunisia to kickstart their Under-20 World Cup campaign.

articles.title: Argentina unveils 2,000-peso banknote as value of currency plummets
articles.description: New highest-denomination bill is officially worth only $8.50 and just over $4 on parallel markets with inflation on course for 130%
articles.content: Argentina’s new 2,000-peso bill, the country’s largest-denomination note, went into circulation on Monday, though due to fast depreciation of the currency it is worth only $8.50 at the official exchange rate and just over $4 in commonly used parallel... [1104 chars]

articles.title: England wins and France loses at U20 World Cup
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — England beat Tunisia 1-0 and France collapsed against an organized South Korea 2-1 at the Under-20 World Cup on Monday.
articles.content:
BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — England beat Tunisia 1-0 and France collapsed against an organized South Korea 2-1 at the Under-20 World Cup on Monday.
Dane Scarlett’s first-half header proved to be enough for England in La Plata. Tunisia had few oppo... [747 chars]

articles.title: Australia’s Socceroos locked in for rematch with World Cup winner Argentina in China
articles.description: The Socceroos will take on world champions Argentina in a friendly match in Beijing on June 15, six months after they faced off at the World Cup.
articles.content:
The Socceroos will face world champions Argentina in Beijing on June 15 in crucial preparation for their Asian Cup tilt and World Cup qualifying.
The long-rumoured friendly clash at the newly-renovated Workers’ Stadium is to go ahead, just over six m... [1832 chars]

articles.title: Humongous, 100-foot-long dinosaur from Argentina is so big its fossils broke the road during transport
articles.description: About 90 million years ago, a ginormous long-necked dinosaur measuring nearly 100 feet (30 meters) long lumbered through what is now Patagonia, Argentina.
articles.content:
The newly described mid-Cretaceous dinosaur Chucarosaurus diripienda was likely about 100 feet (30 meters) long. (Image credit: Sebastián Rozadilla)
